Job Posting:175073 - Position: W26 Information Security and Compliance Analyst Intern 175073B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 11/14/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 11/04/2025 03:25 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Interac Corp. Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Information Security and Compliance Analyst Intern 175073B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Information Security and Compliance Analyst Intern At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that's not all. Whether we're leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada. Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you. The Business Information Security Office falls under the Infrastructure and Operations Business unit (I&O) - I&O is considered as one of the largest business units under the CTO office. The intern will directly be reporting into the Business Information Security Officer and will assist the BISO by participating in all activities of the group, which covers Operational/Information Security, Privacy, IT Compliance, Audit and Assessments, Risk Management, and Security Awareness Training. The candidate will have the opportunity to work with a diverse range of teams across Interac, supporting the critical infrastructure that Canadians rely on each day. You'll be responsible for: • • • Promoting information security awareness within Infrastructure and Operations (I&O) teams and other key business units. Conducting analysis and reporting on operational and information security risks within Infrastructure and Operations (I&O). Reporting and monitoring of high value metrics for: risk mitigation, IT controls, and exception filings using internal tools. Escalating any security, privacy incidents as appropriate. • Supporting the team in creating Monthly Operational Security reports for Senior Leadership Team (SLT) and Executive Committee (ExCo). • Engaging with teams to capture and assess new risks which will feed into the IT Risk Register owned by the BISO office. Preparing teams for various audit and assessment related activities to ensure compliance. • Job Requirements You bring: • Currently completing an undergraduate degree from a creditable Canadian institution with a focus on Computer Science, Information or Cyber Security, Information Business Systems, or someone who understand processes or Information Assurance (or a related discipline). • Experience in supporting risk reporting activities. You contribute to ongoing efforts by analyzing data, generating insightful reports, and assisting in the assessment of risk factors. • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. You effectively promote information security awareness and articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively. • • • • Eagerness to learn new concepts and technologies, with a drive to stay updated with industry trends and advancements. Have strong technical and organizational skills with a keen attention to detail. You demonstrate proficiency in managing complex tasks and maintaining high standards of accuracy. Strong skills with Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel (formula writing, CSV support, pivot tables), PowerPoint and Visio. Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: Experience with Power BI • Workstyle: Hybrid (3 days on-site) Location: Toronto Term: January to April 2026 Duration: Monday - Friday Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Careers at Interac Corp. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
